DataElement.preferredName: Thrombotic Microangiopathy Sign or Symptom Present Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the thrombotic microangiopathy sign or symptom that was present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Thrombotic Microangiopathy Sign or Symptom Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The syndromes of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia, and variable signs of organ impairment, due to platelet aggregation in the microcirculation._Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom)._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The syndromes of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia, and variable signs of organ impairment, due to platelet aggregation in the microcirculation.:Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).

Concepts.definition: A microvascular coagulopathy that may result from systemic vascular endothelial injury triggering the development of a procoagulant state, activation of the complement cascade, and microthrombi formation. Signs may include hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia, hypertension and renal dysfunction.
Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Thrombotic Microangiopathy Sign or Symptom Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The syndromes of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia, and variable signs of organ impairment, due to platelet aggregation in the microcirculation._Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom)._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Neurological Deficit or Dysfunction Without Other Explanation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Neurological Deficit or Dysfunction Without Other Explanation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of pathologic function within the central or peripheral nervous system, secondary to developmental abnormalities, infections, neurologic damage, or tumors.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: A set of statements describing a group of facts that clarifies the cause, context and/or consequence of those facts.

Concepts.definition: A finding of pathologic function within the central or peripheral nervous system, secondary to developmental abnormalities, infections, neurologic damage, or tumors.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A set of statements describing a group of facts that clarifies the cause, context and/or consequence of those facts.

PermissibleValues.value: Increased serum LDH above institutional baseline
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Increase Serum Lactate Dehydrogenase Measurement Above Institution Baseline

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Increase Serum Lactate Dehydrogenase Measurement Above Institution Baseline
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.: A quantitative measurement of the amount of lactate dehydrogenase present in a sample.: In a place or position that is higher.: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.: A starting point to which things may be compared.

Concepts.definition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.
The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
A quantitative measurement of the amount of lactate dehydrogenase present in a sample.
In a place or position that is higher.

An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.
A starting point to which things may be compared.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute or chronic condition that is characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: A set of statements describing a group of facts that clarifies the cause, context and/or consequence of those facts.

Concepts.definition: An acute or chronic condition that is characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A set of statements describing a group of facts that clarifies the cause, context and/or consequence of those facts.

PermissibleValues.value: RBC fragmentation and >2 schistocytes per high-power field on peripheral smear
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than Two Schistocyte Count High Power Field Blood Smear

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than Two Schistocyte Count High Power Field Blood Smear
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.: A measurement of the schistocytes (fragmented red blood cells) in a biological specimen.: The area visible under the maximum magnification power of the objective being used in microscopy.: A sample of blood applied in a thin film to a microscope slide for study under a microscope.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
The determination of the number of schistocytes present in a sample.
The area visible under the maximum magnification power of the objective being used in microscopy.
A sample of blood applied in a thin film to a microscope slide for study under a microscope.

PermissibleValues.value: Negative direct and indirect Coombs test results
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Negative Finding Direct Antiglobulin Test And Indirect Antiglobulin Test Outcome

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Negative Finding Direct Antiglobulin Test And Indirect Antiglobulin Test Outcome
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.: A measurement of the antibody or complement-coated erythrocytes in a blood specimen in vivo.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A test that uses Coombs' reagent to detect the presence of anti-erythrocyte antibodies in serum.: The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.
A measurement of the antibody or complement-coated erythrocytes in a blood specimen in vivo.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A test that uses Coombs' reagent to detect the presence of anti-erythrocyte antibodies in serum.
The result of an action.
